result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian J. Giese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain fulltime work/fulltime schooling.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Counseling and treatment as recommended.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber privileges for work/school/treatment or combination. No objection to EMP.

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 8:37 am 
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Ken Andraski;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves:
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver THC-PTAC-Second and Subsequent Offense)>>DRI
Ct. 3 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place-Second and Subsequent Offense-PTAC)>>DRI
Ct. 4 (Felon Possess Firearm)>>DRI
Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
  
PLEA: Ct. 2 (Possess w/ Intent-THC-PTAC-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/H-3 years probation. CONDITIONS: 90 days MCJ w/Huber priviliges for work/school/treatment or combination and no objection to EMP, AODA and follow up, counseling and treatment as recommended, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Good faith effort to maintain Full time work/Full time schooling, Court Costs. COURT finds 3 days jail credit. 
 
Adjourned: 8:48 am
Plea hearing on April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing set
and Demand for Discovery & Inspection

COURT finds waiver freely and vol. made, probable cause - defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.

Ken Andraski

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety-drugs. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202-drugs.   No contact with victim(s): M.G.
